page.title: 15SCHOOL
page.content: Belchamp St. Paul Church of England Primary School was built in 1967, replacing the 100+ year old building. Children aged 5 to 11 years attend the school and come from the village, Belchamp Otten,Belchamp Walter, Ovington,Tilbury and Pentlow. There are 46 pupils (1985) but unless there is some building in the area the number will decrease. There is a headmaster, an infant teacher, a part time teacher, secretary, welfare lady, two cooks and two dinner ladies. School starts at 9.05 and ends at 3.30 The school is well equiped with books, computer, T.V, video recorder & camera The children have a wide, varied and full curriculum. The school is well known for it's sporting activities, pantomimes and exciting educational visits such as to Bruges, flying over the school & camping in the mountains.
